intro: Tragacantha talassea, commonly known as the talassian tragacanth, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant produces a valuable gum, similar to tragacanth, which has been historically used in medicine and as a binding agent. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Tragacantha talassea is also noted for its adaptability to drought conditions.
